title: Man says he looks ‘like a zombie’ because of ulcers from rare skin condition
text:
Steve Young says he looks like a zombie because of a rare skin condition (Picture: Caters News)

A man says he looks ‘like a zombie’ after a rare skin condition left him covered in flesh-eating ulcers.

Steve Young, 32, was diagnosed with Pyoderma Gangrenosum in August 2019 after spending 18 months searching for a cause of the painful sores and puss-filled boils.

The former carpenter had to give up his job because of the condition and says he’s dependent on a cocktail of drugs to stave off the crippling pain.

Steve, from Honiton in Devon, spends 25 minutes a day dressing his wounds and says he’s frightened to leave the house due to horrified stares from strangers and the constant risk of infection.

Describing the toll it has taken on him, he said: ‘It’s completely ruined my life, I feel like a prisoner in my own home.

‘I’ve said to myself that I look like a zombie. I don’t go out now, the weather is too cold and I can’t chance it due to the risk of developing an infection.’

Steve was diagnosed with Pyoderma Gangrenosum in August 2019 (Picture: Caters News)

Steve said the pain felt ‘like someone sticking in knives at various points across your body continuously’ and said he needs help washing and dressing, robbing him of his independence.

‘If I go out people will just stare at me,’ he added.

‘Some people will come up and ask me “what’s wrong” but most just stare.’

The condition can develop for no reason and results in boils and blisters developing into painful ulcers that ooze fluid across the body and can become dangerously infected.

Steve noticed boils cropping up on his face in December 2017.

The former carpenter had to give up his job because of the condition (Picture: Caters News)

He was referred to a dermatologist the following year who told him they had ‘never seen anything as aggressive before’.

Four skin biopsies failed to find what was causing the ulcers, which continued to grow bigger and more painful.

Now he is trying to raise money to seek private treatment for the condition.

‘I’ve tried all sorts of medication and nothing seems to work,’ he said.

‘I’ve been on steroids for 18 months and I’ve put on three-and-a-half stone.

‘All I want is to live a normal life and to get back to work. For the condition to go away would be the world’s best Christmas present. It would be a breath of fresh air.’
